title: Without Ceasing
text:
Hello team,
Surely you have heard many times: “Always pray and never slack” which is taken from:
During these last weeks, I hear it almost every day because I have a brother (Ezekiel) who keeps talking about it.
Some have stopped praying because they didn’t see results, others have slacked off because they feel they no longer have the time or the strength to pray. It’s very easy to break a prayer habit if you’re not careful because there are many factors that can cause you to slack off. If Jesus asks us not to slack off, it’s because we have a lot to gain.

title: Without Ceasing
text:
Chronos vs Kaïros
God is never late, he is always on time. Many people slack off for the same cause: “God is slow to respond.” We need to be aware of three things:

We are children of God, so God has an obligation to take care of us.
God always gives us our needs (not our passions) when we ask him because he knows what is good for us.
he time fixed by God (kaïros) may not be the same time (chronos) that we hoped for but God does everything good in its time.

Understanding these three things will lead us to pray differently and not to slack off even if it is late.

title: Without Ceasing
text:
Don’t let your guard down
It is often said that nature abhors a vacuum, I noticed that when we relax in prayer, we start doing other things (and very often things that do not bring us closer to God). To relax is also to let our guard down because by doing so, we easily expose ourselves to our adversary, the devil who never stops prowling.
Jesus, in the Garden of Gethsemane, had resisted the temptation to do his own will because he wanted to do the will of God and then he said to his disciples:






Matthew 26 : 41



Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.


Not letting go keeps us from falling into temptation.
From the moment you start to be lazy to pray, there is urgency and you have to get up to pray otherwise it will start with little laziness and it will end with a great relaxation.
Delay in God’s response is not an option for slacking off. The flesh is weak, so we always need the Holy Spirit to keep us going. May the Holy Spirit give us to pray without ceasing.
For those who are on vacation, good rest but do not relax. Have a good day and see you next week.

title: Who are we?
text:
shamayim is a Hebrew word used in the Bible to describe the heavens, the dwelling place of the Most High.






Genese 1 : 14



And God said, “Let there be lights in the firmament of the shamayim to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs and for seasons, and for days and years;



Who are we?
shamayim - christocentrik is a christocentrik librairie, a publishing and editing platform. It offers the possibility of publishing mainly blogs and books.


What is Christocentrik?
Christocentrik is a space that brings young and old together in Christ †. We believe that Christ is the edifice on which everything rests. Christ is therefore the center and circumference of all that exists, the visible and the invisible. He has received the Name above every other name and His throne is the highest in heaven( shamayim 😉 ) and on earth. So, like shamayim, all our works are for this glorious king. For more information contact us


Our vision






Daniel 12 : 4



But thou, O Daniel, shut up the words and seal the book, even to the time of the end. Many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased.


This is our vision

A knowledge base: this platform enables the transmission of the excellence of Christ’s knowledge.
A learning platform: a place to seek the light that is Christ.
A space for evangelism: a place for evangelism through the written word. We believe that words inspired by the Holy Spirit are spirit and life, and that they are capable of bringing Christ to those who hear or read them.



All our content is open access under the Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) license. You can consult the details of this license for more information.






Proverbs 23 : 23



Buy the truth and sell it not, also wisdom and instruction and understanding.



We wish you an excellent journey in Christ in the shamayim. 🚀
